page.title: 10STRUCTURE PLAN S.REIGATE
page.content: "The Surrey Structure Plan pro- vides a framework for town and country planning in the County and is prepared by the County Council. Proposals for the use of individual pieces of land are made in a local plan by the Bor- ough Council. London is surrounded by a "Gre- en Belt" which is meant to stop Lon_ don expanding into surrounding country -side,and prevent towns within the Gr- een Belt from merging into each other. Most of Surrey is in the Green Belt and,outside the towns(in our area Rei- gate,Redhill and Salfords),only devel- opment concerned with farming or out- door recreation is normally allowed. In the towns building is allowed only to meet the needs of local residents. The Structure Plan contains policies on how many buildings should be built, also for protecting our environment."
